Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I am very happy with my ...
Item.Review:
Pros: Light Weight,Sound Quality
Cons: Top Adjustment
I am very happy with my recent purchase. It was easy to hook-up to my sony tv. The battery life is great, the battery charging docking system is easy to use. I've had 3 other head phones in the past. This is the best. For the price hands down go and buy these ones
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have a $300 pair of Bose noise cancelling headphones; these are definitely not even close to those in build or sound quality. Did I mention they were $300? (and aren't wireless). I bought these as a second wireless set for us when one wants to watch tv in bed without disturbing the other (I have radio signal Sennheisers in the livingroom - which were about twice as much as these). The Good: They are fairly inexpensive for a wireless set, especially one coming from a well-known company. Sound quality is decent enough, especially if just using to watch TV. A slight hiss which is easily drowned out when it is receiving a signal. The infrared transmission means no danger of outside radio (cordless phones, wifi, etc) interfering. It comes with a rechargeable battery, but may be swapped out w ... ith a single regular alkaline AAA battery, which is good. These will supposedly last about 60 hours, vs. about 30-40 hours for the rechargeable on a full charge. The Bad: Infrared = Line of Sight. If you can't see the transmitter, you won't hear anything either. My Sennheiser transmitter sits inside a cabinet out of sight; this baby must be on display for all to see. A 28 foot (advertised) range within a 90 degree angle must be adhered to. The rechargeable battery thats included is a weird little monkey that sits in a AAA slot - but is NOT an AAA battery, which is sucky, as you can only get them from Sony. Even though you can use a regular AAA (or another brand of rechargeable), you cannot recharge other rechargeables using the stand recharger (why, why, why, Sony??) I would recommend this to anyone wanting something affordable for watching TV or not wanting to be tethered to their computer while listening to music. Definitely not audiophile equipment, but good value for the money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound Quality,Compact Design,Affordable,Added features,Rechargable,Easy To Use,Easy to set up and use,Long battery life
I already had 2 of these headphones and I just bought 2 more sets so each member of my family can all wear one. We have 3 TV sets and have a unit hooked up to each one. You can also connect to DVR, DVD player, PC, VCR, or other devices with RCA plugs. The headphones are interchangable, so it will work with any of the units. It's great to use when others are sleeping. Easy to hook up and sound quality is very good. Adjustable volume control and on/off switch is simple to use. Infrared signal is easier to use than using wireless radio frequency type of headphones (no need to search for signals). The only negative thing would be that it can get a little un ... comfortable if worn for a long time because the foam ear pads can flatten. I highly recommend this product. You can't go wrong for the price. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Wonderful, light, just what I wanted
Item.Review: I bought these to use for my music practice. I play bass (often at odd hours) and didn't want one more cord to trip over while I practiced. These work great. They are lightweight and the sound is quite good. Now, if you are a sound purist, you may be a wee bit disappointed as these are not studio headphones (the price should tell you that). But they are great for everyday use. I hear the highs and lows as they were intended. I hook them up to the TV while my wife sleeps and they're great. You must maintain line-of-sight to the transmitter, but the range is quite good. I plan to buy another set of these.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Issues to know before U buy.
Item.Review: Infrared wireless is line-of-sight, i.e., if you can't see the transmitter you can't hear on the headphones. The headphones work fine for me but I only use them while sitting on the couch, while watching TV. ONE ISSUE THE BUYER MUST KNOW ABOUT: The rechargable battery that comes with the headphones is a Sony-modified-standard-rechargable-NiMH-AAA-battery. Each end of the battery sports a rather large square piece of plastic whose purpose in life is to trigger a switch that prevents the headphone battery charger in the IR transmitter from charging a non-Sony-modified battery. I searched the internet and found only one web site (interestingly, not the Sony website) that had the battery (Google BP-HP550)...the cost of the battery on that web site was $40! I properly disposed of the Sony ... modified battery and bought some good quality NiMH AAA batteries and bought a good battery charger, capable of charging AA and AAA rechargable batteries. There is a google-findable web site that explains how to super glue the switch in the earphones so one can use regular AAA dry cell (non-rechargable) batteries or regular AAA NiMH or NiCad rechargables. I would not recommend overriding the switch...if someone installs a non-rechargable battery in the headphone and puts it on the charger that is integrated in the IR transmitter, bad things will happen. Particularly dangerous for old folks who are not technically astute, or people who have over-active kids (young and old) around that are not technically astute. Note that I selected difficult to use as a con...that was because of the battery situation described above. Actually, eliminating the battery problem for a moment, the earphones took about 30 seconds to set up and worked first rattle out of the box. It took another 30 minutes to get the IR transmitter and the wire hook-ups to be asthetically pleasing to my wife. Sound is great...now I can hear those chirpy little voices that move with the speed of a modern Gattling gun that are so common on news and sitcoms now days. I selected the IR headset because it is less prone to interference that is common on RF (radio frequency) headphones. Plus, I didn't want to get so tied to the TV that I wore the headphones around the house and in the yard all day so as not to miss a single happening in the world. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: We have IR headphones in the bedroom and in the adjacent living room we use RF so my wife and I can listen to different programs late at night. The problem we have had with previous IR headphones is that when we used 2 head sets at the same time I could never get clear reception. Not a problem with these Sonys , the signal is clear and sound is the best I have had with this type of wireless. The small headphones are also light and comfortable. My only complaint is the rechargeable battery is specific to the headphone.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use,Acceptable sound for TV,Comfortable,Compact Design
This is a very good product for general TV listening. No cord is the main feature. Unit is plugged into phone jack. To get best result turn headphone volume down and amplifier volume up.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: great range great sound
I was in the market for wireless headphones that way I could listen while fan or ac is on and hear tv without having to blast it. I was looking at several options. Most were either cheap china 5 in 1s or more exapnsive 100 dollar ones. This was 45 but can be bought around 35 if on sale. The reason I ended up choosing this one is becasuse it has a AC adapter for charging and also for the base. Other cheaper models had lots of reviews that say without the ac adapter you will eat your batteries quick. So this is a major plus for this model. You also can place a recharge sony battery in their so ac recahrges. However if you don't use the weird sony battery square brackets you cannot charge on the base statation. You will have to just out in batteries and ch ... arge them with soemthing else. I can do good distance for me so i can lay back in bed and walk around my bedroom and still have a connection. The charging station placement takes a little effort to get it aligned, but i never had a problem after a few trys. I doubt anyways will get it perfectly aligned the first time though.
Most of the cheap chinese 5 in 1 models used FM frequiences to broadcast. This means you can walk around anywhere so from one room to the other. However, this sony model is infred, which means When i walk to the bathroom I can no longer hear my tv show. It has to be line of sight. Ofcourse I knew this going in and hope other people looking at this are aware of this. The major thing is I didn't expect how much I really wanted to be able to walk into another room and still hear a tv show. If you want to do that and not just wear these so your spouse doesn't hear you at night then reconsider RF or other methods. However, the sound quality was very exceptable for me. It did sound differnt alot more "deeper" like EVERYthing was bass boosted? expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Regardless of the smaller size as fas as the ear covers, I thought that it would be nice but it was really impressive as far as sound goes. The really down side is that you can not walk far from the base, like maximum 15 or 16 ft and the interference starts, and you have to be directly in front of the coneother ways doesn't work good. It is a good product for the price but i expected more from SONY.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: sounds great when in line of sight
Item.Review: I set this up for my father in law and he loves it. It allows him to watch his blues concert DVD's with out annoying my my mother in law. Clairty and quality are superb. I tried it out and listened to FOX's baseball coverage and I felt like I was in the stadium. The only downside is the line of sight reception. If you go around the corner from the transmitter to grab something from the kitchen, the signal completely cuts out. So far, the rechargeable battery seems to be working great.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Other than being affordable, this product is worthless. As soon as you turn them on, you can hear background static/hiss. It's continuously noticeable. The sound quality is poor. At high volumes, the highs and mids turn into a painful screeching that could possibly damage your ears. The range is also incredibly short.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
Item.Review: I was looking for wireless headphones. Most were radio type. These are infrared. Downside is that they are line of sight so I can't wander the house and get a signal. The upside is that when I am in the room they give a solid signal that I don't have to tune. I use these in bed so I don't keep my wife up with TV noise. The stereo signal is very good and the sound is much better than I expected. The rechargeable battery is great. All you have to do is drop the phones in the charger and they are ready for you next time. My bald head would appreciate a little padding on the top, but overall I'm very pleased with this purchase. I happened upon them at Circuit City - but they don't seem to sell them on line. They should. Good price for a good product. It has my endorsement.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I thought this would be a good unit because it was a Sony. Bought it for my dad who is very hard of hearing. Problem is when you turn the volume up using the headphone control, you get a hiss. The louder the volume, the louder the hiss. My dad is sitting 10 ft away, directly in front. I have to keep the volume low at the headphone, and turn the volume full blast at the TV, but with the TV speakers off so they dont blow. Sound quality is OK this way so its not the headphone speakers themselves. Only reason I dont return them is they didnt cost much in the first place and my dad is happy with the way I have it set up. I love everything else about them, but if you are looking for sound quality, dont get them. They arent worth the price, even at [$].

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great value for price - does the job.
Item.Review: Now we can stay together in the same room with the wood fire without he who wishes to watch a loud action movie disturbing she who wishes to read quietly. The headphones are lightweight and easy to set up/connect, and the wearer can enjoy high volume sound without others in the room hearing the noise (be sure to turn up the volume using the TV's own control before switching to the headphone and then adjusting the headphone's own volume control knob - or you'll get the low hissing background some have referred to here). I think the sound quality is plenty good (the Sony big screen's own sound quality is not something audiophiles would approve). A red light on the charger cradle lets you know when you've correctly seated the headset for charging (it's a bit fiddly). A VERY GOOD produc ... t for the purpose, and especially for the price - arrived very quickly. If you've been considering something like this, don't hesitate. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I second jhjr4 in that the other reviewers don't understand audio equipment. Turn up your source volume to max (or near it) and then slowly turn up your headset. Be careful not to unplug the headphone jack otherwise you'll wake up the neighborhood with your speakers. They give great sound when setup properly. IR needs line of sight so make sure you can setup them so, otherwise, you'll have poor quality. The headset is comfortable. It doesn't squeeze your head and they are very light. If you move your head rapidly they could fall off. One note, the ear cushions fall off constantly. Once they came off the 1st time I couldn't get them to stay on. Probably could use some glue to tape but still, it's a pain. I actually lost one of the cushions so I am hoping that I can order replacement cushion ... s. Without the cushions, the set is almost un-wearable. All in all for the price, sound, and comfort...a great value. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My 4 star rating is based on the function of this headphone for what I designed my AV installation to do. I purchased 20 of these units to function as hearing assist devices for 5 televisions set up in a room showing content while an audio track played overhead. Since the audio track would have drowned out the televisions I had to solve the problem of creating listening stations. These headphones adequately provided access to the audio of each television via the IR transmitter/base unit with minimal issues. Some static is present in the headphones as a result of interference from the overhead lights and the TV screen. However they accomplish the job for which they were designed. For the price, it was the best solution without going over budget. Overall the headphones are good, they ... do what the specs say (provide audio when in range of the IR base station, which gives you about 20 feet of good audio reception) and as a bonus the Headphones work with different IR transmitters so they can work with different systems. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Ease of setup and sound quality are good. Works very well for watching TV when sitting on the couch. The main con is likely typical for any infared design: Treadmill operation cuts out the reception. Moving the transmitter beside the treadmill did not overcome signal interference. Also they fall off rapidly if bending over.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Bought these steareo headphones so that I can watch TV at night without distrurbing my wife while she sleeps. Set up easily to my high-def set and worked exactly as I had hoped. Clarity is excellent, charge holds for well over one week, and recharge is a no-brainer. Headset is light and comfortable, with easy-to-use volume control and on/off control on the earpiece. Only downside is that the headset tension is a bit light, so if you lean forward, the headset may slide out of place. For the money, a very good buy.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use only to listen to TV drama, comedy ect. I do not use for music. I am somewhat tone deaf and my hearing is not too acute. for my purposed, these are great phones at reasonable price. There is a persistent hiss, but I accomodate after a few minutes and do not notice. Range is about 20 feet and angle of transmission is maybe 30 degrees. This is no problem in my livingroom. I found the instructions easy to follow. I have had the phones only2 weeks and can't say how long they will last

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My mother is hard of hearing and these headphones provide a clear sound with no outside interference. Because they have the capability to recharge, they don't use up batteries quickly.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are remarkably light weight, but deliver the full sound expected from a Sony product. If you know someone who is hearing impaired, this is an ideal gift. The quality and affordability make it 5 stars.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought these because I can not hear the television real well without turning the volume way up. This seems to annoy everyone else in my household. I also like to stay up late watching tv, so the loud television has a tendency to wake people up. I decided to buy wireless headphones to see if that would help. I went with a cheaper pair, becuase I was skeptical that they would work. Needless to say, I was wrong. These Sony headphones do a good job. I can put them on and hear the television just fine without turning the volume way up. The signal does not cut out in any way. The battery life on these headphones has been just fine. Everyone in my household is very pleased with these headphones. I can hear the television and my family doesn't have to have their eardrums ruptured bec ... ause of a loud tv. I would highly recommend these headphones to anyone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I am satisfied with the product.
Item.Review: These headphones are clearly not intended for listening to music at high quality. But I have been using them to listen to my TV, and am delighted with the ease of setup, ease of use, long battery life, and apparent immunity from interference. You can't use them outside the room, and the sound quality is good but not great. Perfect for TV. Even if obstacles partly block the infrared path, the sound continues uninterrupted. The headphones are comfortable and light, and run for many hours before recharging. I am satisfied with the product.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought one set and loved it. I use it to watch tv as hubby goes to bed very early. Wanted to have others in the family be able to watch tv too so bought 2 more sets. My tv/sound system won t allow for more than one set to be connected and no one could tell me if the 2 new sets would run off the original set s IR signal (even Sony Tech couldn t tell me) but I bought them anyway with the idea they should whalla! All 3 sets receive off the original IR signal. Just plug them all in to a power source so the sets can recharge in their base you re ready to go. A final word to those complaining about strength of the IR signal...if the headset is fully charged or has a good battery in it the signal is great, even when you turn your head but let the battery go low the signal gets weaker. Just keep ... your head sets fully powered. These are certainly not recommeded if you want to be able to walk around room to room. For the price you cannot ask for a better product. The sound quality is fantastic, has great volume control on the headset, so lightweight you hardly know you re wearing them. Great product at a great price here. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I purchased the headphones to block out some of the noise in my office as we work in adjoining cubicles. The headphones only work if I am facing the base and within about 5 feet of them. If I turn around in my chair to access my file drawers I completely lose the signal. As long as I am facing the base and within about 3 feet the sound is not great, but good.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Product Review for Sony MDRIF240RK IR Headphone
Item.Review: These do exactly what I wanted., a way to watch TV late at night when I get home from work without disturbing the household. I had hissing until I figured out how to set them up. Plug them into the earphone jack. This turns off the TV speakers and just leaves the headphones on. Turn the headset volume down and turn the tv volume up loud to 65 or so. Remember the TV speakers are off now. Then adjust the headphone volume to your comfort level. No hissing. If you leave the tv at normal volume setting and try to turn up the headphone volume you will get hissing.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: NO hiss at all if u read the manual. ;)
Item.Review: Nice product, works as described if you read the manual ;). See below for the actual text out of the manual for how to set them up properly and avoid any hissing. I feel it's a bit cheaply built for the price but then outside of things like Rolls Royce, Ferrari and like what isn't? :P They take a bit of adjustment so they sit flat on my ears. Also the elastic/spring mechanism that makes them fit to your head is quite strong and I take them off once in a while because they make my head/ears hurt a little from the pressure they exert. For those of you complaining about hiss: You would have no hiss if you read the manual since the very FIRST step of the operating instructions tells you how to prevent that. ;) 1) Turn on the audio/video equipment connected to the transmitter. If the tr ... ansmitter is connected to the headphone jack, SET THE VOLUME CONTROL OF THE AUDIO SOURCE EQUIPMENT AS HIGH AS POSSIBLE but not so high that the audio signal becomes distorted. So with your headphone jack plugged in, turn the volume of the headphones all the way DOWN and the volume of the tv/stereo all the way UP. Then you adjust the volume on the headphones UP. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My grandfather has suffered from bad hearing for years. He finally needs a set of headphones so that he doesn't scare everyone out of the room when he watches a movie or turns on the TV. These worked great as an application for DVD or satellite to wireless headphones. Note how I did say or. I wish that Sony would build in a feature to include a switching mechanism in the unit. It could only cost them $5 more. There was not really a way to hub everything through his all-in-one entertainment system (satellite TV, DVD, VCR) and get one single cable to work into the headphones... we just didn't have the capability or the budget. So, we opted to have two headphone to RCA cables that we labeled, and he would switch manually. It's not to say it isn't possible to use this for an all-incl ... usive application. Our equipment at the time just didn't produce a good result. For some reason, the TVOut from his 5-year-old Sony falt tube TV didn't sound as crisp as it did coming straight from the DirectTV box... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: This is my third Sony MDR-IF240RK
Item.Review: I now have three Sony MDR-IF240RK wireless headphones. One is over three years old and all work great. We have several TV's located in seperate rooms and you can walk into any room and hear the audio. I hope they will continue to make these for years to come. You can't beat the price either.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Is someone turning up the tv to loud?
Item.Review: This product does what it sais.. Easy hookup, I used the RCA's sound out of the Cable box vs the small headphone jack in the tv. Using the headphone jack disables the tv speakers which we did not want.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: You have to place yourself in the right spot in front of the sensor in order to receive a clear signal. Otherwise you will hear a hiss or even worse. The range is not as good as I thought.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought these headphones as a gift for my husband for Christmas (Christmas 2011). He loves watching TV at night before bed and I like to go to sleep without alot of noise. I figured wireless headphones would be a great way to have the best of both worlds! So far, the hadphones have worked great! He can turn the volume up loud and I can't hear anything! These may or may not last several years due to the spongy material that cover the speakers, but even if they last a year, I've definitely gotten my money's worth due to the price. It was a good buy. ...

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: A friend has a pair of these, I used them a lot. With a house full of people that all hate football, I was able to listen to the games without having to listen to all the noise and chatter of all the other people in the house and they don't have to listen to the game, and when we were watching movies, I still used the headset cause I am deaf in one ear, and any other noise in the room takes away from listening to the TV. These were exactly what I needed for home, as when she goes to bed well before I do, I have to turn the TV down so low, it's difficult to hear. Now, I can mute the TV, and listen to it as loud as I want, and she can't hear it, and it works the other way around when she wants to watch something and I'm in bed, or trying to get some work done on the computer. Sound seeme ... d tinny at first, but after you get used to them, the sound is actually much better than the TV speakers. TV is a new 40-inch Sony Bravia. The only negative, and it's a small one, is that the charging light will go out at least once a day, and I have to juggle the headset to get the light to come back on. The manual is confusing as to whether this is normal or not. A small negative, and the only thing that caused me to rate it 4 stars instead of 5. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This is perfect. It's got the volume on the headset itself, and that's pretty convenient, easy to hook up, long battery life, etc. The only downside for me so far is that when I go to use the bathroom and it loses connection with its stand, all you hear is loud static. Drives me crazy. But for its price, I guess that's negligible.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My mom and her friends are over 90 years old and a bit hard of hearing. That doesn't stop them from streaming Netflix from the flat LCD TV I installed for her. The problem was that they all were falling asleep because they couldn't hear the audio well enough. I bought three of these headphones and hooked one pair up to the TV and presto.. Smiles all around! All three work off one transmitter like a charm. I needed to buy an optical to RCA converter for $20 though but I knew this up front as these don't have a digital input.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought one of these over two years ago when I lived in an apartment. I couldn't hear dialogue without cranking up the volume to levels that would travel through the walls to the neighbors unit. With these I could understand dialogue without having to turn up the volume to deafening levels. One important note though: I used this with an LCD TV. Burglars stole the LCD and I replaced it with a Plasma. The headphones didn't work anymore. I thought it was the battery (a standard, rechargeable AAA works, save your money and time trying to track down the expensive Sony replacement). A new battery didn't make a difference. I tried the headphones on a standard TV (cathode ray tube) and it worked again. An internet search revealed that IR technology does not work with Plasma TV's. Only g ... et this if you have a standard, LED, or LCD TV. I still use these headphones back in my bedroom on a standard TV. It still work great after two years. Another note, it works best if you are within a 60 degree angle from the front of the emitter. ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My husband is an insomniac & watches TV late into the night. HD programs with surround sound would keep me awake. With the headset, he can now watch TV to his heart's content without waking anyone in the house. MY SALVATION!! ...

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: A bit too much static for my taste
Item.Review: I bought these to listen to TV in the morning as I awake way before my wife. I found the product easy to set up and pratical, but I am disappointed by the static that seems to occur unless I sit at a precise distance and angle from the base unit. Given the relative low price, I assume I got what I paid for and will look to upgrade in the fututre.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound Quality,Easy To Use,Super product
I own a set of these headphones, on the recommendation of a good friend. I can watch tv with sound as loud as I need, while my husband doesn't have to be blasted by it. My daughter can sleep soundly in the next room while I am watching tv. I bought two sets for Christmas to give as gifts--both recipients had said they would really like to have them. It's a reasonably priced, can't go wrong gift.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Perfect for those with some hearing loss to watch tv or listen to radio, etc. Much cheaper than hearing aids. So far the rechargeable battery is working fine, but since it takes alkaline AAA batteries, I'm not worried about it. Good range for one room. Doesn't go through walls, but I already knew that. Very light and comfortable. I can wear it for hours.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable,Easy To Use
I live in a house with two young children and a busy wife. On weekend mornings there seemed to always be some sort of background noise making it difficult to hear my TV shows. These headphones did the trick! Great product.
Personal Note: I am deaf in one ear and there is no Stereo/Mono option so I had to buy a Stereo to Mono adapter for less than $5.00. Not a big deal, but it could easily be a built-in feature.
Minor Con for me, but not enough to reduce the Star-rating - there is a faint baseline of static that can be heard during quiet sections of the show, or whatever you are listening to.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: We use most often while riding loud exercise equipment. The sound is very good. There can be a bit of a hum. This goes away if primary volume of stereo is raised and headset volume is lowered. Range and direction are critical. IR light doesn't go through solid stuff and doesn't bounce around obstacles. Rechargeable battery must be replaced with special one from Sony. (grr)

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: A Good Value Infrared Wireless Headphone
Item.Review: Absoulutely what the doctor (I'm a Ph.D.) ordered! Bought to be interference free, and is mostly easy to use and comfortable fitting, with adjustment. Have mine sitting on top of computer, where hookup is convenient and headphone is reachable. Two considerations: replacing on cradle needs some extra attention, and there is some hiss, which is not objectionable when listening at lower levels.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use,Great Sound Quality,Added features
I use this product at night as I have insomnia and don't want to disturb others who are sleeping. The only problem is the ear area is much too small and uncomfortable to the point of being painful. Otherwise they are perfect.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these headphones at night to watch TV while my wife sleeps. They work great and can be used for hours with no discomfort. They are light weight and the ear pads are really nice.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: At my age, I need the TV volume louder than my daughter (or anybody else) can endure. I'm a night owl and enjoy watching what I've TIVOed at a volume loud enough so that I can catch every word. My daughter likes for things to be quiet and dark so she can sleep. This wonderful product has made both of us very happy. I can, and do, recommend it to friends. I'm delighted with mine. So's my daughter! Good night, all!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This is my second one. I have tried many and the large ear pads cause me problems because I wear hearing aids. I liked this one so well I searched for another one and was lucky to find it. The service also was very good.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: bought one a few months ago worked great, just bought 2 more. use for tv in multiple rooms so I can hear without others suffering. recommend without reservation. nice touch of silence not static if you walk out of the room. must put on charger just right

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Cons: Poor Sound Quality; Did not work wcable box; Difficult To Use
Nothing great about product...out of 5 TVs it only worked one one and sound quality was poor.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My husband is becoming hard of hearing and must turn up the volume of our t.v. to an uncomfortable level for me. He also likes to watch t.v. late at night when I'm trying to sleep. These are the perfect solution. He can listen at his level and I can at mine, or I can go to bed and all is quiet. Excellent quality and perfect solution for an aggravating problem. ...

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Iam so happy that my husband does not have to turn up the volume on the TV for me. The headphones are very comfortable, light on the head and work very well. The sound is clear and I can control the volume on the earphones. The product is well made. SONY did a good job!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am hard of hearing, so this product works well for me. I just ordered the second set so I can leave the tv and the DVD player hooked up, and won't have to change plugs. I have recommended it to several friends.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good bang for the buck
Item.Review: I didn't need a high end set, used mostly while exercising so I could hear while on a bike. This set works well and is light weight. More expensive systems would be a waste for my application.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: my husband and i love these headphones because our TV is in the bedroom. when he watches TV and i want to sleep i can't hear even a whisper. being wireless is great. very easy to use. the sound quality isn't stunning but if you're used to any ol' TV speakers, these headphones are just as good as that. for richer sound you do need to spend more. my husband and i are perfectly happy spending less and hearing just fine.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I am very pleasantly surprised with the headphones that I ordered. The sound quality for TV watching is very good and I do not bother my wife who is trying to sleep. There was a little buzzing which I corrected by adjusting the volume. Also you have to face the sensor pretty directly or the sound goes off. All in all I am very pleased.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This headset has a lot of background hissing. The range is terrible. I bought it to use on our treadmill in front of the TV. The treadmill is 8 ft from the TV, and it barely connects. So this product is useless to me. I will be contacting tech support, as it could be a faulty unit.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Do not buy, they are unusable
Item.Review:
Pros: None
Cons: Even Within A Cm Of The Transmitter.,They Make An Unbearable Hissing And Crackling Sound
Do not buy these, they are unusable, they make an extremely loud an irritating hissing and crackling noise, while barely being able to hear the actual sound they are meant to be playing. Absolute waste of money, if their were 0 stars, that's what I would give this.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: ????
Cons: Hiss & Static
I got these with the express purpose of enjoying TV while exercising. The amount of extra hiss & static was unbearable when on the treadmill . . . an absolute waste of money.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Connected to HDTV/cable box; very easy to set up and clear instructions; excellent transmission of sound; set is very light and comfortable to wear; great value for money! Charging time is quite long but does not limit the full use of the headphones when it matters!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have been using these headphones for a while now for watching TV, gaming and Music without bothering anyone. One of the best features is that it doesn't interfere with the cordless phones at home. It has auto recharge which is the most convinient feature. The range is not a lot.. soo if you are close around then its good but not to hear music far off.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Love this headphone system. I have hearing loss but with this system I hear all the spoken words & pick up background effects IN STERIO. It lets me enjoy & understand movies & T.V. again. REALLY GREAT!!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable,Great Sound Quality,Easy To Use
I bought these because my husband cant hear good he loves them they work great and there a good price for wireless headphones

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: We have two of these headphones for our family room Bravia TV that are WONDERFUL. We enjoy British movies and you can actually understand every word using the headphones. He wears them for all TV watching as he is a bit hard of hearing and I don't have to endure the loud sound. I can even mute the TV, and he can listen at whatever volume through the headset. I bought them at Brookstone, but now they just have their brand. BAD! We set it up in the bedroom. The volume you get through the headset is what the TV is set on. Therefore you can't have one person sleep with the other is watching TV like with these Sony ones. We should have come to this site for another Sony.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These will not work with a 50" Panasonic Plasma TV. There is too much interference from the TV. Also tried on a 36" Panasonic LCD. They worked much better but still had a slight static noise in the background. The headphones are comfortable. Price is right.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I bought this for my dad that is nearly deaf in one ear and has lost most of the hearing in the other. He has it hooked up to his TV and can hear the TV great without disturbing the whole house! The only drawback is that the receiver has to be in line of sight (which most do). All in all this is a great product for the money.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Does this work with analog or digital audio source
Item.Review: Please get the information from the mfr if this item requires analog or digital audio source*. This is a KEY feature to know before shipping items back and forth trying to get a correct, functioning product.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm not an audiophile so I didn't expect that quality, but sound quality is much better than I expected. Just using this for strictly watching TV at night without disturbing the sleeping family(the wife really appreciates this as I have hearing loss). I'm sure that IR is a better method of transmission than radio waves due to less possible electrical interference. ` Very happy with this purchase!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Comfortable; Great Sound Quality
I use for TV because I have a hearing problem,I was very surprised how good these headphone were the first time I used them,I don't think you could do better for twice the price.VERY SATISFIED.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Partner can enjoy TV w/o bothering me
Item.Review: I bought these when my partner announced she wanted to restart a cable TV service. I had enjoyed the quiet of not having the TV blaring, so we agreed that when I'm home she will use these. So far they work well - you just need to make sure you put them in the dock properly (at a slight angle leaning back) in order for the recharging connection to link up. And turn up your TV's volume before turning up the headphone's volume.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: For the price these headphones can't be beat, plastic band only con but it it can be adjusted for your head no problem. The horizontal angle is reasonable but not real wide. The vertical angle is very good too. I have the transmitter sitting on top of a tall dresser, apprx. 61/2' high and no problems anywhere. These are not hi-fi but they are not meant to be, perfect just for tv in the den or bedroom.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The quality for the price is excellent. Sound is great, headphones are reasonably comfortable. Dell had them on sale for $60 so at that price they were a steal. I mainly use them for XBox 360 use late at night, seeing as I am on the couch and not moving around they are prefect.
Cons: You have to make sure you are fairly close to the transmitter and have it pointed right at you. COuld be a bit more comfortable but really they aren't bad.
Have not used them for serious music listening, there is a bit of hiss but mostly not noticeable.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Because of my reduced hearing capability, this headphone system allows me to set the sound level low enough for my wife to enjoy the program we are watching, while I am able to hear comfortably. One feature that would enhance the product would be to reduce the weight of the headphones

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: It's fine for high volume rock and roll that never has any low passages, but terrible for any more subtle music or television listening. Way too much hiss. Can't understand why this product is on the market.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use,Great Sound Quality,Comfortable,Compact Design
Mother-in-law sharing room with another woman who keeps her TV volume way up, couldn't hear her own TV. Now she can tune in and hear her channels without the competeing noise of her neighbor. Also bought a set for husband who has hearing loss, now the rest of the family can listen at normal volume. Also great for listening with the TV volume off when the kids are in bed. The head set is comfortable but I find the volume control wheel a little small for my fingers. Other than that, these are great.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: good for the price but flimsy
Item.Review: We bought these after our old ones (same model) gave out on us for unexplained reasons...but we didn't want to spend a lot of money so we went with the same model again.They work well but I have difficulty completely drowning out outside noise because it doesn't completely cover my ear. Our old ones lasted a couple of years and then the foam also started to disintegrate.Let's see if they've made any improvements in that sense to these newer ones.All in all, good value for the money they cost.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: seem like good wireless headphones so far. there is a line os sight issue, where you have to be facing the transmitter. as well as a slieght hiss. besides that they are a very good deal for the price.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Added features,Comfortable,Easy To Use,Compact Design
The best thing about these headphones is that my husband, who is partially deaf, can listen to the TV and the rest of the family doesn't have to hear it.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Bought this for my husband to use while watching tv at night, as he is a night owl. He is very particular about his electronics, and so far he is very pleased with this product. Worth the money spent!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these head phones on my television to allow other to watch TV while I handle my clients on the phone and also to play my XBOX 360 while others are sleeping They work great and the sound quality is excellent. There is one negative to note when you leave the room with the headphones the sound is lost but anywhere in the room they work great and the reasons I use them they are fine.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are horrible! Don't waste your money. I only bought them so that I can watch my fabulous Sony TV when my boyfriend is sleeping. If I were looking for something with quality, I'd have returned these immediately. There is lots of static. For my purposes, they are fine. However, I would not recommend them to anyone!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Good quality for the price....Sony is a well known name that is why i decided to order them and they were the least expensive through overstock than any other retailer...They have a good sound to them and it was very easy to use as well as set up....

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: You get what you pay for
Item.Review: I bought this unit 3 days ago and am taking it back. I could tolerate the cheap easy-to-break plastic parts but I could not tolerate the white noise that it transmits. I will pay more for an RF unit which I assume will not have the noise problem.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Have only used for three nights watching tv in the bedroom.Would have given four stars if not for the volume control. Should have been placed at a more easily accessible location. [...]

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I used to have a lot of IR phones, but this one has all the features I was always looking for. We use it to listen to the TV after the kids are gone to sleep. We have two headphones using only one of the IR transmitters ( the not-connected one is covered with a tape ). While it is pricier than the others, it is one of the most comfortable ones with excellent built-in rechargable battery life. Worthy to note that after almost 2 years I still have the original ear sponges. The only not-so-positive thing I can think of is that when putting it back on the recharge cradle, sometimes I miss the recharging-connector, but even that one is fine as there is a red LED showing if it's charging or not... It's a great IR headset.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact Design,Great Sound Quality,Easy To Use,Comfortable
Sony RF headphones work great, can use throughout my two story house, have even used them while walking our dog 100 feet away from our house, glad I didn't buy infrared type. No problems with outside interference. Very comfortable to wear. Takes a while to get use to putting headphones into charger stand.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I did buy this product again
Item.Review: For my wife to enjoy tv programs the volume had to be so high that I frequently left the room. These headphones solved the problem and I bought a second pair for the bedroom tv. With IR you have to be within sight of the tv, but the sound clarity is superior to radio frequency sets which seem to be affected by outside interference in our home.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I set this product up for my elderly mother who is hard of hearing so that she could enjoy TV late at night in her room without disturbing my father. It allows her to set the volumes at louder levels so that she can hear clearly while not disturbing others late at night The product has woorked wonderfully. The only downfall happens when the charge runs low. Other than that it is great.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I use these to practice guitar while learning songs. They allow me to stand and move about rather than be seated and tethered by a chord the whole time. Build quality is reasonably good. They are IR and not RF so line of sight is critical. Extra hiss creeps in when direct sight of base is not aligned just so. Overall there is a hiss ever present and it can be bothersome. Audio response is mediocre. I will try another higher end version of these down the road.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Now I Can Hear Myself Think
Item.Review: No more having to have the TV blasting away, because that one person is a little hard of hearing. He has the headphoes on and I have the TV at the volume I like. Sweet!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: It is not as good as direct wired headphones, but considering the potential for interference in an office environment, it works very well. It is extremely good at filtering out any annoying audio noise that could be caused by a weak infrared signal. As the signal gets weaker it just gets quieter. I can put paper in front of the base and I hardly notice any signal degradation. The base is sitting between my two monitors and I can go anywhere in my cube facing any direction without any signal weakness. I don t, however, recommend it for classical music as there is a definite low level hiss that can be heard at low signal levels.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Added features; Great Sound Quality; Easy To Use; Comfortable; Compact Design
Great product & service

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Easy setup, great value, excellent sound. Use for my TV and stereo. I have reduced hearing, and these solve my problem. I don't blast others out of the room.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: We ordered these because we were tired of TV Ears arms breaking so easily. These headphones sound good and were easy to set up. Wish I started with these.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: very uncomfortable, bad quality sound, lose reception very easythat is anoying!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable,Easy To Use,Great Sound Quality,Compact Design
This product is excellent for the hard of hearing people. Sound is very clear.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again...
Item.Review: Good sound quality ease of use, I would recommend this product to friends.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Connection to TV took 2 minutes. Sound is much better than the Vizio's speakers. Good stereo and now I can understand what everyone is saying.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Sound is good -- light weight

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use,Great Sound Quality,Comfortable
Enjoy TV once again

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: MDRIF240RK - Sony Wireless Stereo Headphone System review
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound Quality,Comfortable,Easy To Use
great product so far.. good sound and easy to use and hook up to tv.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: does't work with plasma t. v.
Item.Review:
Cons: Poor Sound Quality
does't work with plasma t.v. because of interference from t.v. it's self

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: didnt meet my expectations for the cost of the unit. i would have thot it shouldnt have been 1/2 the cost. i sent it back

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: use it for television head set. the sound quality is good,

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Reviewer: Lil cheap but like good things
Item.Review: Good quality for the price you are paying.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great product, reasonable price.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Excellent sound quality. Using with small TV and Mac computer.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great use for privacy and considerations
Item.Review: I use this product to respect others privacy . Sothat they do not have to listen to my choice of t.v. programs . And can do other activities in the same room.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: It is easy to use. Very good sound. Confortable.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: shipped as promised and works great
Item.Review: wife is not bothered and i can hear tv now

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Not worth the money that I payed for it and now it is too late to send them back.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I didn't want to invest in it too much. It's a great product for the price I paid

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: a must for couples who sleep different schedules, light and comfortable

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again and again
Item.Review: quolity of this little thing mach superior than big monsters for 300 $ thank you.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Delivery was really fast and I would recommend this product it works great. I am a first time buyer here and I am very pleased Thank You

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Suburb sound for Tv and Music without disturbing anyone else in the house.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: My girlfriend has trouble falling asleep at night if the television is on and goes to sleep earlier than I do, so these headphones offer a great solution.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Very satisified with my new headphones
Item.Review: I like every thing about my headphones. The only draw back I noticed was the distance from the base I can go, otherwise they are very good.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I've only used it once, and it works for exactly what I wanted it for---to Watch AND HEAR TV while walking on the treadmill.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The headphones are great. Hooked up to wall tv or dvr/dvd...work great!!!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I WOULD BUY ANOTHER SONY MDR IF 240RK
Item.Review: MY DAD USES A HEARING AID. THE HEADPHONES MAKE IT MUCH BETTER FOR HIM TO LISTEN TO THE TV.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: use with hdtv, simple intall, good sound. the range is narrow and the sound is not ajustable as i would like.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The product is great. The fidelity is super. The sound is much better than from the TV set.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: good quality sound handy stand
Cons: none

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: So far so good!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: It works great. Its for ppl who wants non-radio wave based wireless headphone.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This is a great buy. We have bought two, so we can each listen at our own volume and not disturb those doing homework in the next room. Try it.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Easy connect and easy use. Long time battery. Thanks!

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: 2nd purchase of this product because we wanted another set for the house. They work great.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Instructions are so vague on how to set this thing up. Where do you plug them into on the TV?

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Headphones Great Price Great Store
Item.Review: The shipment was fast and we love the headphones - they work with everything. I will buy from B&H again soon.

Item.Item: Sony MDR IF240RK - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have a 42" Panasonic and cannot find an open port to connect the unit . . . no support . . . returning product to Brookstone
